Here is Wolfram, my superhero based off of Tungsten.<br /><br />Appearance:<br />Wolfram's costume and hair is grey to match the color of tungsten. His hair is also very wiry due to the fact that tungsten is very ductile. His cape and his belt are yellow because tungsten is a very good conductor of electricity.<br /><br />Behaviour:<br />Wolfram is often alone because people do not like being around since the colour of his costume is quite depressing. He also sometimes accidentally hurts people because his hands and his feet are made of tungsten.<br /><br />Super Powers:<br />Wolfram's hands and feet are made of tungsten which makes him deal very hard kicks and punches. He is also very hard to harm because his bones are made of tungsten. And since much of his body (bones, hands, and feet) is made of tungsten, he is able to conduct electricity very well.

Appearance: Pluto emits an orange glow due to his core which is comprised of Plutonium-238. He has silver bracelets made of plutonium-239 which help him with his powers, and he wears ray-bans to stop the alpha particles being emitted by the bracelets from damaging his sensitive eyes. The glasses also make him look sick.<br />Behavior: Due his constant emitting of alpha particles, Pluto tends to reside on his dwarf planet Pluto, hence his name. He comes to earth when he thinks he's needed. He also has a short temper whivh is a manifestation of his pyrophoric abilities.<br />Superpower: With the help of his Plutonium-239 bracelets, he is capable of harnessing their energy thus emitting a lazer-like beam which explodes anything it touches. Due to the moisture in his mouth which reacts woth his plutonium core, Pluto can spit fire both from his mouth and in the recording booth. If confronted by an enemy much greatee than himself, Pluto will speed his process reaching critical mass and terminate both his enemy and himself.

<p>Here is my drawing with additional notes </p>

<p> </p>

Tellus (based on element tellurium)<br />Appearance: Tellus has a metallic-silver skin with white crystals protruding out of his back, elbows and knees. In nature, Tellurium is often found as a whitish silver crystal, which is why his skin is has a silver luster, and there are the white crystals incorporated into his skin. His eyes are pure black, which is representative of the allotrope of Tellurium, which is a black powder. In the picture his feet look like that to represent his power, which I will explain later. <br /><br />Behavior: Tellus has spent most of his time alone since a young age. When around him people often experience drowsiness, dry mouth, metal taste, headaches, garlic odour and nausea. If people smell his body odor, they will experience these symptoms. He has had much trouble making friends, especially with the alkalis as they can easily destroy him. Most of his friends are metals such as gold, silver, copper, steel, and lead. They form alloys to become stronger, and these friends are not affected by his body odour.<br /><br />Power: Tellus has the power to change into his different allotropes as he pleases. Due t the fact his crystalline state is extremely brittle, he can transform into his amorphous (powder) state to avoid being broken. Also, his belt is made of lead, which strengthens the resistance of his skin in crystalline form and blocks out his fatigue. But he can only use the lead in his belt so much, that is when he resorts to changing allotrope to avoid being shattered. Another power of his is to attack the central nervous system of his enemies, causing temporary paralysis. Much like how inhalation of aerosol tellurium affects the central nervous system, Tellus has the ability to paralyze or even control his enemies. <br /><br /><br />https://www.lenntech.com/periodic/elements/te.htm<br /><br />http://www.chemistryexplained.com/elements/P-T/Tellurium.html<br /><br />https://education.jlab.org/itselemental/ele052.html<br />

Her name is Leadia<br /><br />Appearance: her eyes are bluish-white to represent the color of lead when it is freshly cut. Her hair is made of lead wires, but look normal because lead is very soft and highly malleable. She wears gloves so that she only affects the people she wants to target (see superpowers). <br /><br />Super power: one of her suoer power is that she can shoot bulets from her fingers. She can also poison people by touching them or their food/drinks (transmit lethal lead dose by touch). She has the ability to coat herself with a layer of lead, rendering her immune to radiation and any of the electrical powers of her potential ennemies. <br /><br />Behavior: she has a dark humor, but she is relatively calm, lowkey, individual (as is this relatively unreactive post-transition metal).

To talk more about her behaviour since rubidium  his highly reactive with other elements she has a very big temper that can switch on at any given time. This is probably her biggest flaw since her supper power involves Seduction and for that she can't just get angry.

<p>Cool design!!!  Your superhero should definitely stay away from water, as when lithium is exposed to H2O, it creates lithium hydroxide. LiOH is soluble in water. Getting out of that situation would be difficult.</p>

Appearance: Curiman is wearing a silver white(color of curium) armour and glows in the dark(curium)<br />Behaviour : His body is highly radioactive that's why he wears an amour to avoid harm to other people. He cannot be touched because the radiation destroys the body of the person who touches him.<br />Super power: His abilities are emitting radioactive wave and produce electricity( curium is a good conductor of electricity )
<p>Your drawing is very nice! Tungsten is very resistant to acids, which might give him an edge over certain enemies. Seeing an interaction between the two substances would be pretty cool!</p>

<p>Due to arsenic being a brittle, solid, very poisonous and toxic, Lucidum can break little pieces off of herself and put them into peoples drinks or put them into peoples mouths while they are sleeping.</p>

<p>The drawing is amazing by the way! Due to you being very brittle and soft, you should beware of who you make enemies with because any element that is more dense and harder than yours will cause severe damage.</p>

<p>Very cool design and the idea of having a shield as his weapon of choice is fantastic since he protects other metals from corrosion. Did you know that zinc is a very common element in the earth's crust? Maybe you can give Zincanator a new power which allows him to ground pound the ground and create a earthquake-like effect that damages nearby foes; which relates to the amount of zinc found in earth's crust.</p>

<p>Very cool character and I really like how his behavior on how people don't like speaking to him is caused by fluorine's pungent odor. Did you know that fluorine is toxic and even more toxic then lead? Maybe you could add a new super power to Fluorider where he is able to poison people with his toxicity which weakens his foes.</p>

<p>2. also contact with pure aluminum can have harmful effects. people can suffer from loss of memory, damage to the central nervous system, etc. so maybe when his enemies come into contact with him he can let down his layer of aluminum oxide so when they touch him, they experience memory loss or damage to the central nervous system. </p>

<p>Cool drawing and ideas! </p>

<p>1. Since Tellurium has many isotopes, maybe another super power for Tellus would be to release clones that look like him but have the properties of his isotopes. This would confuse his enemy as he would not know which one is the actual hero and it would overwhelm him as he would not know who to attack. This would make Tellus' enemy easy to defeat as he is in shock as a result of the many clones created by Tellus. </p>

<p>2. Also, Tellurium when heated releases toxic fumes, so when he is exposed to the sun, his body can increase in temperature (heat up) and release these toxic fumes. When an enemy inhales these fumes, their power decreases over time as poisoning which will cause internal damage and possibly kill the enemy thus making it easy to defeat his foes.</p>

<p>hey cute drawing! I didn't know about the chemiluminescence process so it was interesting to read. You could also talk about how red phosphorus is the pointy tip at the end of matches, which make them ignite And maybe add that it is very easy to annoy/make her mad since she is so easy to ignite. :) </p>

<p>loving the abs on your character haha. You could add a little fun fact about titanium being one of the first elements to be discovered by modern chemists. And another one of her superpowers could be that she is immune to attacks coming from acids and chlorine, making it harder to beat her. good job:) </p>

<p>4) Adding a super power ability: I really like the idea that Krazy Flamer is able to create a lilac flame from the water in her bracelets, it is very clever and very dangerous at the same time! I have an idea of a super ability that you might want to consider; the floating ability. Because potassium (0.862 g/cm3) has a smaller density than water (1g/cm3), your super villain can have the ability to float on water when wearing her suit. Consequently, if it occurs that she is attacked and ends up in water, she would not drown. Hope it helped, and good luck!</p>

<p>4) Adding a behaviour property: I love the whole idea! Yan is a sick name, and its ability to send oxygen wherever it is needed is so smart; it really makes a great super hero. I have an idea that you might like for one of its behaviour. As we know, photosynthesis is a process used by plants which releases oxygen. Consequently, you might want to add to Yang's behaviour that he is super environmental friendly; he respects all the nature around him and planet earth itself. Plants are his friends if you want. Also, if you want an idea for his enemy for the story you will write, consider one that cuts of trees or destroys forest! Good luck with the rest of your project!</p>

<p>I love, love, LOVE what you did with "Mad Merc"! His powers are really unique while fitting the element perfectly. Your element is used in thermometers, so I was thinking as an extra super power the "Mad Merc" could tell the temperature and sense if enemies were near. I also loved your idea about naming your super villain "Merc the Jerk"! ;)</p>
<p>I like how your hero is a vegan, by the way! I was thinking as an added power or gadget, he could shoot neon lights with either a gun (like batman) or through his hands. </p>
<p>Gold is also a good conductor of heat and electricity!</p>
<p>Copper is also very ductile and melleable, so your character could stretch and take any form she desires! Your superhero's physical description is is well thought-out!</p>

<p>Love the drawing. You could say that Strontium (in high quantity) can be a danger to the health  of children because it can disrupt bone development. Also, that your character, Skeletium could react with Chromium and become Strontium Chromate and be super toxic to humans since he has a vendetta against them. Strontium Chromate can cause vomiting, nausea, abdominal pain, coughing, soar throat, redness on skin and many other effects. The most dangerous one is lung cancer.</p>
<p>Cute drawing. You can also say that Vanadium is very malleable and ductile, hence he could manipulate his physical features to disguise himself (to some extent) and/ or have elastic powers.</p>

<p>I really like the description of your character. You're ideas are great. Although you have described her as stubborn, maybe you should consider her having a soft spot which is potentially bad when fighting crime. She would have a soft spot because Barium is a soft, silky white metal. Because barium was one a getter for vacuum tubes, maybe it can be a cool idea to say that when her opponents looked her directly in the eye, she would suck the soul right out of her villains, turning them into stone. Maybe this superhero has a sidekick Chalcogens, and when they work together they are unstoppable because of how energy they become. I'm saying this because when Barium and chalcogens combine together they are exothermic, meaning that they release great amounts of energy,</p>

<p>I really like the fact that the Hydrogen can be used to sneakily due to the fact that it is colourless, odourless and tasteless. You should try making a tag team with the character Sulshot by Mark A because when put together, Sulfur and Hydrogen can create Hydrogen sulfide. Hydrogen sulfide is a colourless gas that is highly poisonous, flammable and has a smell that resembles rotten eggs. </p>

<p>I like the concept of your character a lot. It might be interesting to add that Radium is radioactive and when it enters the body, it cannot all be excreting therefore it enters the bloodstream which can be very dangerous. Exposure to this element can be detrimental due to the alpha and gamma rays which are emitted during decay, can kill or cause a mutation of cells. </p>

<p>you did a great job with your superhero, loving the drawing! What's interesting about copper is that if your character could somehow incorporate having some nitric acid, it can react with the copper to create a reddish-brown cloud of nitrogen dioxide which can be harmful to your enemies when it gets into their system.</p>

<p>Nice drawing! Iron reacts with oxygen in moist air to create iron oxide, i.e. rust. This can be your hero’s weakness, hence the need for her super suit to have the ability to envelope her body and protect her from oxygen. This may also explain why she stays away from people, for fear that if exposed, her skin will begin to rust.  </p>

<p>The concept of your character is very interesting! As a form of protection, you can use the fact that Vanadium is largely used in the production of steel which is extremely tough and can help you when facing your nemesis. </p>

<p>When exposed to oxygen, Rubidium catches fire. To avoid this, it is stored in kerosene. Perhaps Galactic Ruby should be forced to bath in kerosene  every night before she can go out and seduce her victims in order to maintain her good looks and not catch fire thus ruining her plans too quickly.</p>

<p>Awesome drawing! I find it funny that his good lucks shine, inspired by the shininess of the metal silver. Did you know that silver is an extremely reflective metal? An idea for a superpower could be that he could blind his opponents by reflecting light into their eyes. </p>

<p>Nice drawing! I think it was really smart to draw the character through a magnifying glass because it emphasizes how small she is. Hydrogen also has a very low density. In fact, hydrogen is less dense than air, so a cool superpower she can have is the ability to fly. This would be very convenient as since she's small, she can fly up to high and hard to reach places. </p>

<p>Amazing drawing! BUT I see that your superhero is in flames maybe reaching sulfur's melting point (~100 degrees) if that is the case, Sulshot MUST AVOID Ferrumina (The Iron Superhero), because it will make an extremely exothermic reaction, basically both of you guys being killed in contact. This is a weakness that I highly suggest considering. </p>

<p>Phosphorus compounds are often used in fertilizer, so Phosphorella could have a green thumb! Although your character cannot interact with humans, she can still help them by helping to grow food.</p>
<p>Lithium is also corrosive! Lithman could use this to his advantage and hurt his enemies by corroding their skin.</p>

<p>Wow! cool superhero! But did you know that a deadly weakness of Ferrumina could be heated sulfur, just like the superhero named Sulshot. If ever you guys made contact, it would have produced an explosive ending to your life (SULFUR in liquid+IRON in solid=Exothermic reaction). Therefore, I advise you to stay from him.</p>

<p>I love Carbono's dreadlocks. He looks dope. Carbon monoxide (CO) is an odourless gas that is produced from the burning of fossil fuels. Your hero can benefit from this if he can somehow incorporate this gas in his suit. With a click of a button, he can kill his enemies since it is deadly. His mask should be made out of graphene which is an allotrophe of carbon. It is the thinnest and strongest material ever known.</p>
<p>Also, you can say that your superhero works alone, due to his offensive odor. In addition, you can produce blue flames (it gives a cooler look) if you have pure oxygen in the suit.</p>

<p>I like the backstory you created for your character. Bismuth can be fatal in large doses if absorbed by the body. The amount consumed by the body can affect whether it simply causes irritation or if it kills the consumer. One of your character's powers could be using Bismuth to either eliminate, or incapacitate their enemies since you mentioned your character can't physically fight on her own.</p>

<p>I love how you linked Chlorine's disinfecting qualities to her behavior and appearance. Chlorine is usually found in either the liquid or gas form and can dissolve in water. One of your character's powers could be that she has the abilities to easily undergo a phase change and use either a water way, or the air, to quickly travel around and reach her destination faster.</p>

<p>Really interesting that your superhero helps with cancer treatment. Platinum also very resistant to corrosion so the shield aspect is very relatable. With that being said, your superhero should have an armor that would protect him from all sorts of danger. </p>
<p>Lithium is also the lightest solid metal so maybe your Lithman could be super light allowing him to sneak up on people and not make noise when he walks.</p>

<p>Really interesting superhero. Did you know that lead reacts to strong temperature changes, for example, powder is formed in heat and in cold. It turns orange when hot and yellow when cold. You could add a power depending on the temperature when it's cold or hot.  </p>
<p>Lead tarnishes when exposed to air so maybe she could have a suit to protect her.</p>

<p>This illustration is amazing! It reminds me of Sakura's hair in "Naruto".. So cool! The appearance is well constructed<strong> </strong>and it is base with the element's characteristic. </p>

<p>Suggestion: cesium also reacts violently with sulfur, phosphorous, acids, and halogens (fluorine, chlorine, bromine, iodine and astatine). So it would be nice if she will have an enemy who posses one those element</p>

<p>Really cool drawing and I love the idea of his super power!! For later on, it's interesting to note that silver can be slowly corroded over time by sulfur compounds in the air and it can turn silver darker and not as shiny</p>
Gold could also be black, ruby or purple colour when finelly cut.

<p>I really like your drawing and how indepth Brominella's description is. Bromine also dissolves really well in organic liquids and a little bit in water, so maybe another part of her personality could be that she blends in really well in a crowd!</p>
When calcium is in contact with air it causes a oxide and nitrite coating, which protects from corrosion. That could be an other property or superpower.

<p><strong>Calcium could have an enemy named Phosea ( Phosphorus). Due to the fact that when they are both combined together, they create calcium phosphide, which is extremely toxic to aquatic creatures. Plus, you could make his eyes silvery-white just like calcium metal.</strong></p>

<p><strong>https://www.lenntech.com/periodic/elements/ca.htm</strong></p>

<p>The character is impressive because it is holistically connected to the element itself. You've research it very well which is great! I like the fact that you put a belt at her and make her less vulnerable to her opponent, also she would probably portray a feisty super villain!  </p>
<p>Very cool idea! tungsten has the highest melting point in some elements, so if he comes across some elements that can melt it would be very cool to see that!</p>

<p>Must agree with that "glasses also make him look sick" statement! When small particles of Plutonium are inhaled, they might remain in the lungs or in the organs which can expose body tissues to radiaton and cause cancer. Maybe Pluto could exhale a large amount of those small particles around his enemies to make them extremely sick (causing their death). Plutonium also releases a lot of heat and is often used in spacecrafts as an energy source. Pluto could use his heat to power his own spacecraft, and use it to travel from Pluto to Earth. </p>

<p>Great idea! An interesting power could be that he has a double/copy of himself as oxygen is a diatomic element. Also he could have the ability to clone himself due to the presence of  0, 02 and 03.</p>

<p>Cool idea! Tungsten is used for various cutting and drilling tool, so an interesting power could be that your hero could create blades or sharpen his limbs into something blade-like. Also, the drilling component could be used as a possible story component.</p>

<p>I like the details on your drawing and his suit. Since mercury is a great conductor of electricity, Maybe having a pack that can help him have superpowers with electricity and use it as a weapon.  </p>

<p>Your drawing is quite impressive Dante, another property your character could have, can be to generate high levels of energy which can lead to Pluto having powers to create and control electricity, according to "chemistry learner.com", almost around 10 million kilowatt-hours of electricity is produced by one kilogram of Pu-239.</p>

<p>Also, when probably very angry, Pluto could have the ability to generate nuclear power. Pluto could, in the very toughest of situations, create a fission reaction, by having the nuclei of certain heavy atoms split into smaller, lighter nuclei, releasing high levels of energy. However, it is important to mention that he should not use this power often, as this power might create chaos.</p>
Idea for power : ability to control animals, because very high doses of cesium increase or decrease the their their activity.

Nice character concept! <br />Super power idea : Your character could communicate and control deep-sea creatures which have shells, because they incorporate strontium inside of their of them. The strontium inside then would allow your character to control those creatures.
Since Cesium have a melting point very low to room temperature maybe when she removes her glove her hand can form the blade :)

<p>Franny's 87 symbol is radioactive, so I would suggest that perhaps, since Francium has the ability to be laser-trapped, Franny's suit can have lasers in it that do this. Now that she can choose when her symbol emits light, she should be able to choose when her symbol emits its radioactivity. For instance, when her symbol lights up it emits radioactivity, and when it goes dark it emits nothing. kind of resembling the bat signal but with a radioactive flare to it. Or maybe when she goes invisible then she stops emitting radioactive rays and that's why she's always alone because the only time she can be around her friends is when she's invisible. Sounds depressing but wtv. </p>
Since copper is essential to human and animals maybe she can control them somehow using conductivity, also copper could be toxic so she can maybe poison her victims as well.

<p>Brominella has pretty awesome super power abilities! Bromine is somewhat transparent. This can be another one of your character's ability. Since she can shift to the gas state of bromine, she'll practically be invisible to her enemies and it'll be harder for them to attack her. </p>
<p>Very cool! If you want you can add that they have control of when the radioactivity is there so that they are stronger. This could also mean that the suit only changes color when it is needed.</p>
<p>Very cool! Maybe the dots on the suit could have some sort of purpose instead of being decorative. Maybe a source of zinc or where the shield comes from!</p>

<p>Great Idea! A suggestion: with superheroes becoming more and more dark and gritty with each movie that comes out, if you wanted to do the same thing, I have an odd/creepy superpower for you. As oxygen is one of the primary components of air, he could have himself be breathed in by an enemy, and perhaps control them through their blood(which also contains oxygen). </p>
<p>Since Lead is very malleable, maybe she could be super flexible. This could help dodge attacks, like Neo from the Matrix.</p>

<p>Lots of good ideas. The comment of "heat sensor" is worth looking into. The behavior could be embellish a little. Since he is cold when is in solid form, maybe that also doesn't help him make friends.</p>
<p>Great job researching possibilities. Make sure you mention precisely HOW he gets Tellurium into (or onto) his enemies.</p>
<p>Good exposition of the possibilities of Lead. Everything seems good. Does your character date a plumber, since the Latin for lead is <em>plumbum</em>, the origin of plumbing.</p>

<p>Interesting character. Be more precise when you describe her behavior. Great comment about the kerosene bathing. She seduces people, so she's a smooth tongue (wheedling). How exactly does she poison them? (how does the liquid get into/onto the enemy, and how does it affect the enemy?).</p>

<p>Promising character. Look over the behavior again. Useful feedback from your peers, use them. Dig a bit more into the chemistry of silver. For example, Silver is an anti-microbial &amp; anti-bacterial, so he could rarely be sick.</p>

<p>Original character, very promising. The suggestions of your peers are all great and should be considered. The superpower is not really clear. But yes, Oxygen is everywhere, and is needed by every living form. He can produce that. He can probably swim under water no problem, because he literally is an underwater gas tank.</p>

<p>sources: Helmenstine, Ph.D. Anne Marie. “Learn 10 Interesting Neon Element Facts.” <em>ThoughtCo</em>, ThoughtCo, 22 Aug. 2016, www.thoughtco.com/interesting-neon-element-facts-4077247.</p>

<p>“Layers of the Atmosphere.” <em>NIWA</em>, NIWA, 2016, www.niwa.co.nz/education-and-training/schools/students/layers.</p>
<p>Intriguing character. Make sure you clarify her super power, or put it into context. Is she a firefighter?</p>
<p>Intriguing Villain. Be careful, people don't melt, so don't mention that she has a low melting point.</p>

<p>Love the concept. It is original and intriguing. I would stick with his " charitable " character, and not mix the idea that he wants to save kids in hospital, yet wants to kill all humans. The relationship with the rat is also a great plus, and sure can add to the dimension of the character. Keep up the good work.</p>

<p>Rubidium is a highly reactive element. Firstly, it react with oxygen creating <strong>rubidium oxide </strong>and that reaction cause a fire. In really life she can control her suit but allow It to burst into flame during battle. Similarly, it reacts highly with water creating <strong>rubidium dihydrogen monoxide </strong>that then releasing hydrogen gas into the air therefor causing and explosion. therefor if she is around water or trapped in a water conter she can use this reaction to save herself. Lastly, since she is able to make <strong>rubidium dihydrogen arsenate </strong>which she can use to further poison people .</p>

3 different chemical reactions involving that atom:<br /><br />Due to Titana being made out of titanium, she undergoes reactions with air, water, and halogens.<br /><br />When titanium reacts with air:<br /><br />Titanium has an oxidized layer around it preventing it from random combustion, yet when it begins to burn, it burns bright and creates titanium dioxide and titanium nitride.<br /><br />When titanium reacts with water:<br /><br />Same as with burning, the layer of oxide on titanium prevents it from reacting with water. Yet titanium can react with steam to form titanium oxide and hydrogen.<br /><br />When titanium reacts with<br /><br />When titanium and the halogens are heated to around 200C, reactions can occur and titanium halides are created from these reactions.<br /><br />Summary:<br /><br /><br /><br />Titanium is generally a non-reactive metal, it's corrosion resistant from acids, water, and most corrosive substances. Any reactions or corrosion that occur need to be produced under specific circumstances<br /><br />https://www.webelements.com/titanium/chemistry.html

<p>Great ideas, I really like the reaction of aluminum with iodine (my superhero is based on that element), you can maybe add that that purple smoke is very toxic and dangerous for his enemies. I'd like to give you another reaction that might help you, the reaction of aluminum with bromine. Bromine (Br) and aluminum (Al) react together to create AlBr(small3); this creates a lot of sparks made from the liquid aluminum which can be used by Captain Al as a diversion grenade. What do you think?</p>

<p>Bromine reacts very violently with aluminum to create aluminum (III) bromide. The reaction releases light heat, sparks of liquid aluminum. Brominelle uses aluminum to her advantage, she touches it and throws it as she would a grenade to stun her opponents.</p>

<p>Hello Gab, great ideas out there, especially the one of hydrofluoric acid, looks like a very dangerous power and actually relates with what we learnt in class. Another reaction that you might find useful is the one between fluorine (F) and caesium (Cs) creating caesium fluoride (CsF). This reaction creates a very bright white light, which can be used by your super hero to blind his enemies when needed. </p>

<p>Here's a video that might help, start it at 3:30: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TLOFaWdPxB0</p>

<p>Wolfram should definitely stay away from high temperature, as it will probably have negative effects on him. Although acids do not usually deteriorate tungsten carbide, heat certainly does. Wolfram's armour would start oxidizing at around 500°C. A clever rival could use this to weaken Wolfram. High temperatures would also make your hero vulnerable to chlorine. The reaction would create WCl6, a dangerously corrosive compound!</p>

<p>ZnCl2 could be even more dangerous for the Zincanator. If someone succeeds in turning him into zinc chloride, he would then become highly soluble in water. Not only would he have to avoid all contact with water, but he would also have to avoid humidity, as ZnCl2 attracts water vapour. The accumulation of water vapour would then dissolve the compound and the Zincanator would be left in a very frustrating situation.</p>

<p>I really like the concept of Miss H and the chemical reactions look really cool! Here's my feedback</p>

<p>When hydrogen mixes with fluoride it becomes Hydrogen Fluoride (HF). Hydrogen fluoride is a colourless gas. Hydrofluoric acid  is a solution of hydrogenfluoride in water. If hydrofluoric acid comes into contact with your skin it doesn't hurt until a couple of hours later, starts destroying nerves, bones and can cause cardiac arrest if it gets into your blood stream it can cause cardiac arrest.</p>
